fields.title: Harris 2003 Public Opinion Survey, study no. 18677

dsDescription.dsDescriptionValue: Topics addressed in this study include the most important issues for the government to address, ratings of political leaders and parties, life satisfaction, the war in Iraq, industry images, and prices and price controls with a focus on prescription drugs. Demographic variables include respondent's sex, age, educational status, disability status, origin or descent (Spanish, Hispanic, or Latino), race, political party self identification, political philosophy, number of individuals age 18 or o ver, between ages 13 and 17, and under age 13 who live in the household, presence of a disabled individual age 16 or over who lives in the household, household income, and number of voice telephone lines available at home.

fields.notesText: Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: National cross-sectional sample of persons 18 years of age or older interviewed by telephone.; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:ACCESS.CATEGORY  Notes: I; Subject: null  Type: ODUM:CODEBOOK.NUMBER  Notes: H-18677;

distributor.distributorName: Odum Institute for Research in Social Science, University of North Carolina
